option.value: {"D:/LI QUAN/Academics/Final sem/FYP 2/Codes/Code test/Reco":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/home/HomeViewModel.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `HomeViewModel`, which is an `AndroidViewModel` that manages the list of installed applications on the device.\\n\\n`HomeViewModel`: An `AndroidViewModel` that loads and manages the list of installed applications on the device.\\n\\n`getAppList()`: Returns a `LiveData` object that holds the list of installed applications.\\n\\n`loadApps()`: Loads the list of all installed applications, including system apps, and updates the `LiveData` object with the list.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/reco/applock/ExampleUnitTest.java\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test method. It does not contain any other classes or functions.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: This is a unit test class that tests the functionality of the application.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: This test method checks that the addition operation of 2 + 2 is correct and returns the expected result of 4.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a simple example of a unit test for an Android application, which can be used as a starting point for writing more comprehensive tests.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/security/SecurityQuestionSetupActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`SecurityQuestionSetupActivity`: This class represents an activity that allows the user to set up a security question and answer, which are then saved in the app\\u0027s shared preferences. The class also handles the back button press during the first-time setup and navigates to the `PermissionActivationActivity` after the security question is saved.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`onCreate()`: This function initializes the activity, sets up the spinner with a list of security questions, and sets up the click listener for the save button.\\n\\n`saveSecurityQuestion()`: This function saves the selected security question and answer in the app\\u0027s shared preferences and navigates to the `PermissionActivationActivity`.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PatternLockActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `PatternLockActivity`, which is responsible for handling the pattern lock functionality in an Android app.\\n\\n`PatternLockActivity`: This activity manages the pattern lock screen, allowing users to set a new pattern or unlock the app using a previously set pattern.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: Initializes the activity, sets up the pattern lock view, and handles the back button behavior based on whether the activity is in setup or input mode.\\n\\n`savePattern(String)`: Saves the user-defined pattern to the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\n`validatePattern(String)`: Checks if the user-entered pattern matches the saved pattern and grants access if it\\u0027s correct.\\n\\n`grantAccess()`: Grants access to the app after a successful pattern unlock.\\n\\n`navigateToForgotPassword()`: Navigates to the security question authentication activity to allow the user to reset the pattern lock.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/permissions/PermissionActivationActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `PermissionActivationActivity`, which is responsible for handling the user\\u0027s permission requests and navigating to the main activity once all required permissions are granted.\\n\\n`PermissionActivationActivity`: This class is responsible for requesting and handling the necessary permissions for the app to function, and then navigating to the main activity once all permissions are granted.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function sets up the activity\\u0027s layout, attaches a click listener to the \\\"Grant Permissions\\\" button, and handles the back button press to prevent the user from leaving the setup process.\\n\\n`requestPermissions()`: This function requests the necessary permissions (camera, read/write external storage) from the user.\\n\\n`proceedToMainActivity()`: This function starts the main activity and finishes the current activity once all permissions are granted.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/Settings/SettingsViewModel.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SettingsViewModel`, which is an `AndroidViewModel` for managing app settings.\\n\\n`SettingsViewModel`: An `AndroidViewModel` for managing app settings, including admin rights, camera permission, notification permission, and accessibility permission.\\n\\n`getAdminRightsEnabled()`: Returns a `MutableLiveData` object representing the state of the admin rights setting.\\n`setAdminRightsEnabled(boolean isEnabled)`: Sets the state of the admin rights setting.\\n`getCameraPermissionEnabled()`: Returns a `MutableLiveData` object representing the state of the camera permission setting.\\n`setCameraPermissionEnabled(boolean isEnabled)`: Sets the state of the camera permission setting.\\n`getNotificationPermissionEnabled()`: Returns a `MutableLiveData` object representing the state of the notification permission setting.\\n`setNotificationPermissionEnabled(boolean isEnabled)`: Sets the state of the notification permission setting.\\n`getAccessibilityPermissionEnabled()`: Returns a `MutableLiveData` object representing the state of the accessibility permission setting.\\n`setAccessibilityPermissionEnabled(boolean isEnabled)`: Sets the state of the accessibility permission setting.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/reco/applock/ExampleInstrumentedTest.java\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the application\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the application\\u0027s context.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test method checks if the application\\u0027s package name matches the expected value, which is \\\"com.reco.applock\\\".\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/intruderselfie/IntruderSelfieActivity.java\":\"This file appears to be an Android activity class that handles the functionality of an \\\"Intruder Selfie\\\" feature in an app. It does not contain any other classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`IntruderSelfieActivity`: This class is responsible for managing the Intruder Selfie feature, including setting up the directory for storing selfies, handling the toggle switch to enable/disable the feature, and loading and displaying the captured selfies.\\n\\n`loadSelfies()`: This function loads the captured selfie images from the designated directory, sorts them by the last modified date, and sets up the RecyclerView to display them.\\n\\n`showSelfieDialog(File file)`: This function displays a dialog box to show a selected selfie image, and provides an option to delete the image.\\n\\n`onDestroy()`: This function is overridden to cancel any pending Picasso image loading tasks when the activity is destroyed.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PasswordSetupActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `PasswordSetupActivity` class, which is responsible for setting up the password for the app.\\n\\n`PasswordSetupActivity`: This class handles the setup of the password for the app, allowing the user to choose between setting a pattern or a PIN.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function is called when the activity is created, and it sets up the UI and the click listeners for the \\\"Set Pattern\\\" and \\\"Set PIN\\\" buttons. It also handles the back button press to prevent the user from leaving the setup process.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/security/SecurityQuestionResetActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`SecurityQuestionResetActivity`: This class is responsible for allowing the user to reset their security question and answer, which are stored in the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\nThe file contains the following functions:\\n\\n`onCreate()`: This function initializes the views, sets up the spinner with a list of security questions, and sets up a click listener for the reset button.\\n\\n`resetSecurityQuestion()`: This function is called when the user clicks the reset button. It retrieves the old answer, new question, and new answer from the user input, and then saves the new security question and answer in the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides the implementation for an activity that allows the user to reset their security question and answer, which is a common feature in many apps that require user authentication.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/security/SecurityQuestionAuthenticationActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`SecurityQuestionAuthenticationActivity`: This class is responsible for handling the security question authentication process, allowing users to verify their identity before proceeding with actions such as changing the password or security question.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`onCreate()`: This function initializes the activity, sets up the UI, and retrieves the saved security question and answer from SharedPreferences.\\n\\n`verifyAnswer()`: This function checks the user\\u0027s entered answer against the saved security answer and proceeds with the appropriate action if the answer is correct.\\n\\n`proceedWithAction()`: This function navigates to the appropriate activity based on the action type (changing the password or security question).\\n\\n`getSavedSecurityQuestion()`: This function retrieves the saved security question from SharedPreferences.\\n\\n`getSavedSecurityAnswer()`: This function retrieves the saved security answer from SharedPreferences.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/services/AppLockAdminReceiver.java\":\"`AppLockAdminReceiver`: This class is a `DeviceAdminReceiver` that handles the enforcement of app lock uninstallation prevention.\\n\\n`onEnabled`: This function is called when the app lock admin is enabled, and it displays a toast message indicating that the admin has been enabled.\\n\\n`onDisabled`: This function is called when the app lock admin is disabled, and it displays a toast message indicating that the admin has been disabled and the uninstallation prevention is now inactive.\\n\\n`showToast`: This utility function displays a toast message with the provided message.\\n\\n`getComponentName`: This static method returns the `ComponentName` of the `AppLockAdminReceiver` class, which can be used to activate or deactivate the receiver programmatically.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/notifications/NotificationsViewModel.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `NotificationsViewModel`, which is an `AndroidViewModel` that manages the notifications data for the app.\\n\\n`NotificationsViewModel`: An `AndroidViewModel` that manages the notifications data for the app, including adding, removing, and clearing notifications.\\n\\n`getAppNotifications()`: Returns a `LiveData` object that holds the current state of the notifications data.\\n\\n`addNotification(String packageName, String content)`: Adds a new notification to the corresponding app in the notifications data.\\n\\n`removeNotification(String packageName, String content)`: Removes a specific notification from the corresponding app in the notifications data.\\n\\n`clearAllNotifications(String packageName)`: Clears all notifications for a specific app in the notifications data.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build configuration file that sets up the project structure and dependency management for the \\\"Reco\\\" Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the project settings and dependencies.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories for Gradle plugins, including Google\\u0027s Maven repository, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories for project dependencies, including Google\\u0027s Maven repository and Maven Central.\\n\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"Reco\\\".\\n\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module as part of the project.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/managers/LockedAppsManager.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LockedAppsManager`, which is responsible for managing the list of locked and pattern-protected apps in the application.\\n\\n`LockedAppsManager`: A class that manages the list of locked and pattern-protected apps in the application.\\n\\n`LockedAppsManager(Context context)`: Initializes the `LockedAppsManager` instance with the provided `Context`.\\n\\n`getInstance(Context context)`: Returns the singleton instance of the `LockedAppsManager`.\\n\\n`isAppLocked(String packageName)`: Checks if the specified app is locked using a PIN.\\n\\n`addLockedApp(String packageName)`: Adds the specified app to the list of locked apps.\\n\\n`removeLockedApp(String packageName)`: Removes the specified app from the list of locked apps.\\n\\n`addPatternProtectedApp(String packageName)`: Adds the specified app to the list of pattern-protected apps.\\n\\n`isAppPatternProtected(String packageName)`: Checks if the specified app is pattern-protected.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/notifications/NotificationContentAdapter.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `NotificationContentAdapter`, which is a `RecyclerView.Adapter` used to display a list of notification contents in a `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`NotificationContentAdapter`: A `RecyclerView.Adapter` that manages the display of a list of notification contents.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: Creates a new `NotificationContentViewHolder` instance for each item in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: Binds the notification content data to the corresponding `NotificationContentViewHolder` instance.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: Returns the number of notification contents in the list.\\n\\n`NotificationContentViewHolder`: A `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` that holds the views for a single notification content item, including a button to remove the notification.\\n\\n`bind`: Binds the notification content data to the views in the `NotificationContentViewHolder`.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PINInputActivity.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `PINInputActivity` class, which is responsible for handling the user\\u0027s PIN input and authentication process.\\n\\n`PINInputActivity`: This class represents the activity where the user enters their PIN to unlock the app.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function initializes the activity, sets up the PIN lock view, and handles the back button press.\\n\\n`onPinEnter()`: This function is called when the user starts entering the PIN.\\n\\n`onPinComplete(boolean)`: This function is called when the user completes entering the PIN. It checks if the entered PIN matches the saved PIN and grants or denies access accordingly.\\n\\n`onPinDelete()`: This function is called when the user deletes a digit from the PIN.\\n\\n`onPinEmpty()`: This function is called when the PIN input is empty.\\n\\n`triggerIntruderCapture()`: This function is called when the user fails to enter the correct PIN three times, triggering the IntruderCaptureService to capture a selfie.\\n\\n`navigateToForgotPassword()`: This function is called when the user clicks the \\\"Forgot Password\\\" button, navigating to the SecurityQuestionAuthenticationActivity.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/services/AppLockMonitorService.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AppLockMonitorService`, which is a service that monitors the current app being used and redirects the user to a password screen if the app is locked.\\n\\n`AppLockMonitorService`: A service that monitors the current app being used and redirects the user to a password screen if the app is locked.\\n\\n`createNotificationChannel()`: Creates a notification channel for the service.\\n\\n`createNotification()`: Creates a notification for the service.\\n\\n`checkCurrentApp()`: Checks the current app being used and redirects the user to the password screen if the app is locked.\\n\\n`onDestroy()`: Removes the check app runnable when the service is destroyed.\\n\\n`onBind(Intent intent)`: Returns null, as this service is not intended to be bound to.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android SDK version, dependencies, and build types. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the build process for the Android application.\\n\\nThe key elements of the file are:\\n\\n`plugins`: Specifies the plugins used in the project, including the Android application plugin, Kotlin plugin, and the Kotlin Symbol Processing (KSP) plugin.\\n\\n`repositories`: Configures the repositories used to fetch dependencies, including Google\\u0027s Maven repository, Maven Central, and the JitPack repository.\\n\\n`android`: Configures the Android-specific settings, such as the application ID, SDK versions, build types, and enables view binding.\\n\\n`dependencies`: Specifies the external libraries and dependencies used in the project, including core Android libraries, pattern lock and PIN lock view libraries, CameraX dependencies, testing libraries, and the Picasso library for image loading.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/MainActivity.java\":\"This file appears to be the `MainActivity` class of an Android application that uses the Navigation component and a BottomNavigationView to manage the user interface.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the Android application that sets up the navigation and manages the visibility of the BottomNavigationView.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: Initializes the activity, sets up the NavController, AppBarConfiguration, and BottomNavigationView, and manages the visibility of the BottomNavigationView based on the current destination.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/Settings/SettingsFragment.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SettingsFragment`, which is a Fragment that handles the settings UI and functionality for an app lock application.\\n\\n`SettingsFragment`: A Fragment that manages the settings UI and functionality for an app lock application, including admin rights, camera permission, notification permission, accessibility permission, and password/security question management.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Initializes the Fragment\\u0027s UI, sets up the various settings switches and buttons, and handles their corresponding functionality.\\n\\n`onAdminSwitchToggled`: Handles the toggling of the admin rights switch, activating or deactivating the device admin rights as needed.\\n\\n`isDeviceAdminActive`: Checks if the app has active device admin rights.\\n\\n`activateDeviceAdmin`: Activates the device admin rights for the app.\\n\\n`deactivateDeviceAdmin`: Deactivates the device admin rights for the app.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/services/AppLockNotificationListener.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AppLockNotificationListener`, which is a `NotificationListenerService` that monitors notifications for locked apps and handles them accordingly.\\n\\n`AppLockNotificationListener`: A `NotificationListenerService` that intercepts and handles notifications for locked apps, including launching the password input activity, showing a hidden notification, and updating the notifications view model.\\n\\n`onCreate()`: Initializes the `LockedAppsManager`, `NotificationsViewModel`, and creates a notification channel for the service.\\n\\n`onNotificationPosted(StatusBarNotification)`: Handles a new notification by checking if the app is locked, adding a record to the view model, launching the password input activity, and showing a hidden notification.\\n\\n`onNotificationRemoved(StatusBarNotification)`: Handles the removal of a notification by removing the record from the view model.\\n\\n`launchPasswordInputActivity(String)`: Launches the `PINInputActivity` with the locked package name.\\n\\n`showHiddenNotification(String)`: Displays a generic hidden notification for the locked app.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PatternActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `PatternActivity`, which is responsible for handling the pattern lock functionality in an Android app.\\n\\n`PatternActivity`: This activity manages the pattern lock screen, allowing users to set a new pattern or unlock the app using a previously set pattern.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: Initializes the activity, sets the layout based on the mode (setup or input), and sets up the pattern lock view and related UI elements.\\n\\n`savePattern(String)`: Saves the user-entered pattern to the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\n`validatePattern(String)`: Checks the user-entered pattern against the saved pattern and grants access or handles failed attempts.\\n\\n`triggerIntruderCapture()`: Triggers the `IntruderCaptureService` to capture a selfie when the maximum number of failed attempts is reached.\\n\\n`navigateToForgotPassword()`: Navigates to the `SecurityQuestionAuthenticationActivity` to handle the \\\"Forgot Password\\\" functionality.\\n\\n`grantAccess()`: Grants access to the app after a successful pattern unlock.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PatternInputActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `PatternInputActivity`, which is responsible for handling the pattern input authentication process for an app lock feature.\\n\\n`PatternInputActivity`: This activity class manages the pattern input authentication process, including handling successful and failed attempts, triggering an intruder capture service, and navigating to a security question authentication activity for password reset.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: Initializes the activity, sets up the pattern lock view, and handles the back button press.\\n`grantAccess()`: Launches the locked application if the entered pattern is correct.\\n`triggerIntruderCapture()`: Triggers the intruder capture service if the number of failed attempts exceeds the limit.\\n`navigateToForgotPassword()`: Navigates to the security question authentication activity for password reset.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/MyApplication.java\":\"This file defines a custom `Application` class called `MyApplication` that implements the `ViewModelStoreOwner` interface.\\n\\n`MyApplication`: A custom `Application` class that provides a `ViewModelStore` for the application.\\n\\n`getViewModelStore()`: A method that returns the `ViewModelStore` instance associated with the `MyApplication` class.\\n\\nThis file sets up a custom `Application` class that can be used to manage the `ViewModelStore` for the entire application, which can be useful for maintaining the state of view models across configuration changes or other lifecycle events.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file for an Android application project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the build configuration for the entire project.\\n\\nThe key elements in this file are:\\n\\n`plugins`: Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects/modules in the project.\\n\\n`buildscript`: Specifies the dependency on the Android Gradle Plugin version 8.0.0 (or the latest version) for the entire project.\\n\\nIn summary, this file sets up the build environment for an Android application project, ensuring that the necessary build tools and configurations are available for all sub-projects/modules.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/managers/LockedAppsAdapter.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LockedAppsAdapter`, which is a `RecyclerView.Adapter` that manages a list of locked applications and provides a UI for toggling the lock state of each application.\\n\\n`LockedAppsAdapter`: A `RecyclerView.Adapter` that manages a list of locked applications and provides a UI for toggling the lock state of each application.\\n\\n`LockedAppsAdapter(List\\u003cApplicationInfo\\u003e, PackageManager, LockedAppsManager, boolean)`: The constructor for the `LockedAppsAdapter` class, which takes a list of `ApplicationInfo` objects, a `PackageManager`, a `LockedAppsManager`, and a boolean flag to determine the locking method.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull ViewGroup, int)`: Inflates the view for each item in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder(@NonNull AppViewHolder, int)`: Binds the data for each item in the `RecyclerView`, including the app name, icon, and lock state.\\n\\n`getItemCount()`: Returns the number of items in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`AppViewHolder`: A `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` that holds the views for each item in the `RecyclerView`.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PatternSetupActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`PatternSetupActivity`: This class is responsible for setting up and saving a pattern lock for an app lock feature.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`onCreate()`: This function initializes the activity and sets up the pattern lock view and the shared preferences.\\n\\n`addPatternLockListener()`: This function adds a listener to the pattern lock view to handle the completion of the pattern lock setup.\\n\\n`onComplete()`: This function is called when the user completes the pattern lock setup, and it saves the pattern to the shared preferences and displays a toast message.\\n\\nOverall, this file implements the functionality for setting up and saving a pattern lock for an app lock feature in an Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/intruderselfie/IntruderSelfieAdapter.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `IntruderSelfieAdapter` class, which is responsible for managing the display of intruder selfie images in a RecyclerView.\\n\\n`IntruderSelfieAdapter`: A RecyclerView adapter that displays a list of intruder selfie images and handles click and long-click events on them.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: Creates a new `ViewHolder` instance with the layout for a single intruder selfie item.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: Binds the data for a specific intruder selfie item to the corresponding `ViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: Returns the number of intruder selfie images in the list.\\n\\n`ViewHolder`: A private inner class that holds the views for a single intruder selfie item.\\n\\n`OnSelfieClickListener`: A functional interface that defines a callback for handling clicks on intruder selfie items.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/services/AppLockAccessibilityService.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AppLockAccessibilityService`, which is an `AccessibilityService` implementation for monitoring app usage and locking specified apps.\\n\\n`AppLockAccessibilityService`: An accessibility service that monitors app usage and locks specified apps by launching the PIN input screen when a locked app is detected.\\n\\n`onServiceConnected()`: Initializes the `LockedAppsManager` instance when the accessibility service is connected.\\n\\n`onAccessibilityEvent(AccessibilityEvent event)`: Handles accessibility events, specifically `TYPE_WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED` events, and launches the PIN input screen if the detected app is locked.\\n\\n`onInterrupt()`: Logs a message when the accessibility service is interrupted.\\n\\n`onDestroy()`: Logs a message when the accessibility service is destroyed.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/notifications/NotificationsAdapter.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `NotificationsAdapter` class, which is responsible for displaying a list of notifications for different applications in a RecyclerView.\\n\\n`NotificationsAdapter`: This class is responsible for managing the data and presentation of the notifications in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`NotificationsAdapter.onCreateViewHolder(ViewGroup, int)`: This function is responsible for creating a new `NotificationViewHolder` instance when a new view is needed in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`NotificationsAdapter.onBindViewHolder(NotificationViewHolder, int)`: This function is responsible for binding the data for a specific position in the RecyclerView to the corresponding `NotificationViewHolder` instance.\\n\\n`NotificationsAdapter.getItemCount()`: This function returns the number of items (notifications) to be displayed in the RecyclerView.\\n\\n`NotificationViewHolder`: This class represents a single item in the RecyclerView, containing the application name and a RecyclerView for displaying the notification content.\\n\\n`NotificationViewHolder.bind(String, List\\u003cString\\u003e)`: This function is responsible for binding the application name and the list of notifications to the corresponding views in the `NotificationViewHolder` instance.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/home/HomeFragment.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions. Here\\u0027s a summary of each:\\n\\n`HomeFragment`: A Fragment class that represents the home screen of the app, displaying a list of locked apps.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the fragment\\u0027s layout, initializes the RecyclerView, the LockedAppsManager, and the HomeViewModel, and observes the LiveData from the ViewModel to update the RecyclerView with the list of locked apps.\\n\\nThe file is responsible for creating the home screen of the app, which displays a list of locked apps. It uses a ViewModel to manage the data and a RecyclerView to display the list of apps.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/notifications/LockedAppNotificationsFragment.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`LockedAppNotificationsFragment`: A fragment that displays a list of notifications for a locked app and provides a button to clear all notifications.\\n\\n`onCreateView`: Inflates the fragment\\u0027s layout, sets up the recycler view, initializes the `NotificationsViewModel`, observes the app notifications, and sets up the \\\"Clear All\\\" button functionality.\\n\\nThe file is responsible for displaying a list of notifications for a locked app and providing a way to clear all of those notifications.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/password/PinSetupActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `PinSetupActivity`, which is responsible for setting up a PIN lock for an app. The file also includes several functions that handle the user\\u0027s interaction with the PIN lock view and save the PIN to the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\n`PinSetupActivity`: This class is responsible for setting up a PIN lock for the app, allowing the user to create a new 4-digit PIN.\\n\\n`onCreate(Bundle)`: This function sets up the UI and initializes the PIN lock view, handling user interactions such as entering, deleting, and clearing the PIN.\\n\\n`savePin(String)`: This function saves the user\\u0027s PIN to the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\n`onPinEnter()`: This function resets the entered PIN if needed.\\n\\n`onPinComplete(boolean)`: This function displays a toast message when the PIN is entered successfully.\\n\\n`onPinDelete()`: This function removes the last digit from the entered PIN.\\n\\n`onPinEmpty()`: This function resets the entered PIN.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/permissions/OnboardingActivity.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `OnboardingActivity`, which is responsible for requesting and handling the device admin permission required for the App Lock feature of the application.\\n\\n`OnboardingActivity`: This activity is responsible for requesting the device admin permission and navigating to the main activity of the application if the permission is granted.\\n\\n`requestAdminPermission()`: This function initiates the process of requesting the device admin permission from the user.\\n\\n`proceedToNextScreen()`: This function is called when the device admin permission is granted, and it navigates the user to the main activity of the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/ui/managers/AppUsageMonitor.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AppUsageMonitor`, which is responsible for monitoring the current app being used on the device.\\n\\n`AppUsageMonitor`: A class that provides functionality to monitor the current app being used on the device.\\n\\n`AppUsageMonitor(Context context)`: A constructor that initializes the `UsageStatsManager` service.\\n\\n`getCurrentAppPackage()`: A function that retrieves the package name of the currently active app by querying the `UsageStatsManager` for usage statistics.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/reco/applock/services/IntruderCaptureService.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `IntruderCaptureService`, which is responsible for capturing a selfie of an intruder using the device\\u0027s front-facing camera and saving it to the internal storage of the app.\\n\\n`IntruderCaptureService`: A service that captures a selfie of an intruder and saves it to the internal storage of the app.\\n\\n`captureSelfie()`: Captures a selfie using the device\\u0027s front-facing camera and saves it to the internal storage of the app.\\n\\n`createImageFile()`: Creates a file in the internal storage of the app to store the captured selfie.\"}"}
